name: Abernathy House
address: 611 W Via Lola, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This private residence showcases Cody's mastery of desert modernism with its distinctive angled roofline, floor-to-ceiling windows, and sheltered outdoor living spaces.

name: Alexander Steel Houses
address: 290 E Simms Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: These groundbreaking homes pioneered the use of prefabricated steel in residential architecture, featuring modular construction and innovative cooling systems designed specifically for desert living.

name: Architecture and Design Center, Edwards Harris Pavilion
address: 300 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This former bank building exemplifies mid-century financial architecture with its glass pavilion design, deep overhangs, and sculptural concrete screens, now serving as a showcase for architectural exhibitions.

name: Bank of America Building
address: 588 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: The building's striking facade features geometric sun screens and a distinctive entrance canopy, demonstrating how modernist design could make banking both elegant and accessible.

name: Coachella Valley Savings & Loan
address: 499 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The building's unique mushroom-shaped concrete sunshades and floating interior mezzanine showcase Williams' innovative approach to desert banking architecture.

name: Convention Center
address: 277 N Avenida Caballeros, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The center's sweeping horizontal lines and expansive glass walls create a dialogue between indoor and outdoor spaces, while its desert-inspired color palette harmonizes with the surrounding landscape.

name: Del Marcos Hotel
address: 225 W Baristo Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This early example of desert modernism features angular stone walls, creative sun shading, and a distinctive asymmetrical facade that earned Cody early recognition in his career.

name: Desert Holly Complex
address: 605 S Warm Sands Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: Burns' sophisticated approach to apartment design is evident in the complex's horizontal lines, private courtyards, and innovative use of concrete block for both decoration and climate control.

name: Desert Regional Medical Center Addition
address: 1150 N Indian Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This contemporary addition respects the modernist tradition while incorporating sustainable design elements, featuring energy-efficient sun shading and desert-appropriate landscaping.

name: Downtown Palm Springs Redevelopment
address: 123 N Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This modern complex reinterprets mid-century principles through contemporary materials and sustainable design, creating vibrant public spaces that honor Palm Springs' architectural heritage.

name: Elvis Honeymoon Hideaway
address: 1350 Ladera Circle, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This geometric marvel features four circular living spaces on three levels, with stone walls and floor-to-ceiling windows that create a sophisticated interpretation of futuristic design.

name: Elrod House
address: 2175 Southridge Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: Perched dramatically on a ridge, this home's concrete dome roof and retractable glass walls create a spectacular living space that seems to float above the desert floor.

name: Frey House II
address: 686 W Palisades Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Nestled against a mountain boulder, this compact home demonstrates Frey's genius for site integration, with a sloping roof that mirrors the mountain's rise and industrial materials that complement the natural rock.

name: Hidden Frey
address: 1620 Via Roberto Miguel, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This secluded residence demonstrates Frey's masterful handling of light and shadow, featuring his signature butterfly roof and innovative solutions for desert climate control.

name: House of Tomorrow
address: 1350 Ladera Circle, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This bold design features three distinct levels with geometric shapes and cantilevered overhangs, embodying the optimistic futurism of its era through innovative spatial arrangements.

name: Kaufmann House
address: 470 W Vista Chino, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This masterpiece of International Style architecture uses sliding glass walls and strategic overhangs to create a seamless connection between interior spaces and the desert landscape.

name: Kimpton Rowan Hotel
address: 100 W Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This contemporary high-rise hotel pays homage to modernist principles through its clean lines and extensive use of glass, while adding sustainable features and a rooftop pool with panoramic views.

name: L'Horizon Hotel
address: 1050 E Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: Originally designed as a private retreat, this low-slung complex features pavilion-style guest rooms with oversized windows and private patios, exemplifying the indoor-outdoor lifestyle of desert modernism.

name: Miller House
address: 2311 N Indian Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This early desert modern home innovatively combines living spaces with a movement studio, featuring ribbon windows and outdoor living areas that capture mountain views.

name: Movie Colony Hotel
address: 726 N Indian Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: One of Frey's earliest desert works, this hotel demonstrates his emerging modernist style through its innovative sun protection features and efficient use of space.

name: Orbit In Hotel
address: 562 W Arenas Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This intimate hotel complex showcases playful mid-century design elements with its distinctive curved rooflines and period-appropriate furnishings that create an authentic modernist experience.

name: Palm Springs Animal Shelter
address: 4575 E Mesquite Ave, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: This LEED Gold certified facility combines modernist transparency with sustainable design, featuring natural lighting, energy-efficient systems, and desert landscaping that creates a comfortable environment for both animals and visitors.

name: Palm Springs Art Museum
address: 101 N Museum Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The museum's brutalist-influenced design features vertical fins for sun control and rugged concrete surfaces that complement the mountain backdrop while housing world-class art collections.

name: Palm Springs City Hall
architect: John Porter Clark, Albert Frey, Robson C. Chambers, E. Stewart Williams
address: 3200 E Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The building's iconic porte-coch√®re features distinctive palm tree columns and a perforated metal screen that provides both shade and architectural interest, creating a uniquely local interpretation of modernist civic architecture.

name: Palm Springs International Airport Terminal
address: 3400 E Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The terminal combines Wexler's original modernist design with contemporary additions that maintain the open, airy feeling while meeting modern aviation needs.

name: Palm Springs Tennis Club
architect: Paul R. Williams & A. Quincy Jones
address: 701 W Baristo Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This recreational complex seamlessly integrates indoor and outdoor spaces through extensive glass walls and covered walkways, creating a sophisticated environment for sports and socializing.

name: Palm Springs Visitors Center
address: 2901 N Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The building's dramatic hyperbolic paraboloid roof and glass walls transformed a simple gas station into an iconic gateway to Palm Springs, demonstrating how everyday architecture could be elevated to art.

name: Parker Palm Springs
address: 4200 E Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: This luxury resort combines mid-century bones with contemporary designer Jonathan Adler's playful updates, creating a unique blend of vintage charm and modern sophistication.

name: Racquet Club Estates
address: 2743 N Starr Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: This residential development showcases Krisel's talent for creating variety within standardized plans, featuring his signature butterfly roofs and innovative post-and-beam construction methods.

name: Riviera Hotel & Resort
address: 1600 N Indian Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The hotel's distinctive spoke-wheel design and space-age elements reflect the optimistic spirit of the late 1950s while providing spectacular mountain views from every room.

name: Steel Development Houses
address: 300 E Simms Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: These experimental homes used prefabricated steel components to create affordable, elegant housing perfectly suited to desert conditions, demonstrating Wexler's innovative approach to residential architecture.

name: Tramway Valley Station
address: 1 Tram Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The station's modernist design creates a dramatic starting point for the aerial tramway, with clean lines and simple materials that complement rather than compete with the mountain backdrop.

name: Twin Palms (Frank Sinatra House)
address: 1148 E Alejo Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Williams convinced Sinatra to choose this elegant desert modern design over his initial Georgian concept, creating a sophisticated home featuring clean lines, stone walls, and the famous piano-shaped pool.
